title: Selective Decentralization Design for Enhancing Reinforcement Learning Performance

context.prior_knowledge: Feedforward neural networks, basic control systems, and foundational concepts of reinforcement learning
context.additional_context: Reinforcement learning model design course for medical/legal/technical professionals, focusing on workplace applicability. Collaborative learning environment utilizing personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can construct unknown environmental models using system identification techniques in model-based reinforcement learning
Learners can design optimal control strategies by deriving approximate solutions to the Hamilton-Jacobi-Bellman (HJB) equation
Learners can compare and evaluate selective decentralization strategies based on linear/nonlinear system characteristics and determine optimal communication policies

resources: Python-based reinforcement learning framework (e.g., Stable Baselines3)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
